title.narrative: Resilience in the Limpopo River Basin (RESILIM) - Olifants

description.narrative: (USAID Southern Africa Regional): In FY 2016, $2.6 million (71 percent climate change adaptation, 29 percent biodiversity) will build a more resilient Olifants River sub-catchment, which stretches across South Africa and Mozambique in the larger Limpopo River Basin. The project will continue to partner with communities, civil society and the private sector to apply new skills and innovations to address climate vulnerabilities. Phase one, which focused on generating new science to understand key threats, ended in late FY 2015. FY 2016 resources will enable partners to apply analyses and implement targeted actions including technical assistance on climate adaptation planning and biodiversity protection to municipalities, development and implementation of climate and ecological resilience curriculum for higher learning institutions, vocational support for youth, and protection of biodiversity.

participating-org.narrative: Association for Water and Rural Development
